chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S Popaeko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment and/or evaluations including sex offender elauations &I treatment per agent.  No contact w/Z.M. or his family.  No contact w/anyone under 18 years of age unless incidental and only per agent.  No computer use per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
State appears by Atty Linda Hoffman.  DE Eric S Popaeko appears in person w/Atty Stan Woodard.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes letters provided to the Court prior to today's hearing.  Parties have rec/rev all of those documents and are ready to proceed.  Atty Woodard calls PSI writer Nicki Dobbs - S&T.  State does cross-exam.  Atty Woodard does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Atty Woodard calls Dr. Nick Yackovich Jr - S&T.  State does cross-exam.   Atty Woodard does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Atty Woodard calls R.W. - S&T.  State does cross-exam.  Atty Woodard does re-direct.  State does re-cross.  Witness excused.  K.P. makes statement on behalf of DE.  C.W. makes statement on behalf of DE.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Woodard makes recommendation.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Parties discuss sex offender registration.  Court will not rule at this time as to the argument.  That may be addressed at the end of the sentence being served.  Court advises DE of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearm warnings.  

Ct 1:  
7 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision) to commence FORTHWITH
Conditions of extended supervision:
Evaluations/counseling/treatment per agent including sex offender evaluations and treatment
Costs of $518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent (Cash bond to be applied)
DNA sample to be provided
No contact w/Z.M. or his family 
No contact w/anyone under 18 years of age unless incidental and only per agent
No computer use per agent
for a Hearing to Determine if the DE should comply w/Sexual Offender Registration
Sentencing hearing on January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
by Nick Yackovich PHD
Cover Letter from Atty. Woodard
Telephone scheduling conference on December 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Eric S Popaeko in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises court a PSI is to be ordered.  Plea to Count 1.  Attorney Woodard agrees.  No contest plea entered.  Court goes through guilty plea questionnaire.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty and orders PSI to be completed and filed no later than December 5, 2014.  Sentencing to be set after by notice.
Plea hearing on October 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states he needs plea set in 45 days as DE is undergoing some psychological counseling.  State notes matter is set for JT and ADA Hoffman isn't objecting to a reset.  Atty Woodard requests plea and request for PSI be set and JT cancelled.  State agrees.  Court resets.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Eric S Popaeko in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Eric S Popaeko in custody.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  Atty. Woodard states to modify condition of bond, change "not leave State of WI" to live at home in McHenry, IL, check into Lake Geneva IL PD daily and all other conditions remain.  Atty. Woodard talked to Captain in Air Force on DE's status, fast tracking discharge.  State has no objection to living in IL.  No contact w/children under 18 unless supervised by an adult.   No social media w/children under 18.  Check in once or twice a week (Mon. & Fri.).  Court states parties have an agreement, Court will allow DE 1705 N. Dunham St. w/mother D.Petska;  No contact w/any child under 18 unless supervised; Report to Lake Geneva PD on Mon & Fri. every week @ 11:00 AM ; No acts of social media with children under 18; all other conditions remain including $10,000 Cash.

Atty Woodard acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Eric S Popaeko in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Eric S Popaeko in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Just got 843 pages of discovery on Friday.  Requests 3 week reset.  Time limits continued waived.  Return date scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Return date on March 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Eric S Popaeko appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation, at this point Atty. Woodard will be the atty..  State requests $10,000 Cash bond, no ties to State of WI, investigations in IL and MT.  Atty. Woodard makes bail argument, DE in Air Force and requests $4000.00.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $10,000.00 CASH bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/victim ZRM (d.o.b. 5/30/97), or his premises or his family or children under 18 years old; Not leave State of WI w/o prior order of the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
